paragraphs.en: Over the next five minutes, my intention is to transformyour relationship with sound. Let me start with the observation that most of the soundaround us is accidental; much of it is unpleasant. (Traffic noise) We stand on street corners,shouting over noise like this, pretending it doesn't exist.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 在接下來的五分鐘裡我將改變你們對聲音的看法我觀察到在我們四週的聲音通常都是偶然產生的而且大部分是不悅耳的(交通噪音)當我們站在街角，在這些噪音之下大聲談話然後還假裝噪音並不存在

paragraphs.en: This habit of suppressing sound has meant that our relationship with soundhas become largely unconscious. There are four major wayssound is affecting you all the time, and I'd like to raise themin your consciousness today.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 嗯，這種壓抑聲音的習慣讓我們對於週遭的聲音漠不關心聲音會對我們產生四種影響我想藉由今天的機會分享給大家

paragraphs.en: The first is physiological. (Alarm clocks ring) Sorry about that.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 首先是生理上的影響(警鈴聲)

paragraphs.en: I just gave you a shot of cortisol,your fight-flight hormone. Sounds are affectingyour hormone secretions all the time, but also your breathing, heart rate --which I just also did -- and your brainwaves.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 很抱歉，我剛才為你們注射了一劑可體松，也就是刺激你戰鬥或是逃跑的荷爾蒙聲音會影響你的荷爾蒙分泌還有你的呼吸，心跳，就像我剛才做的還會影響你的腦波

paragraphs.en: It's not just unpleasant soundslike that that do it. This is surf. (Ocean waves) It has the frequency of roughly12 cycles per minute.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 不是只有不悅耳的聲音會產生生理上的影響這是海浪(海浪聲)頻率大約是每分鐘12次

paragraphs.en: Most people find that very soothing, and, interestingly, 12 cycles per minuteis roughly the frequency of the breathing of a sleeping human, so there is a deep resonancewith being at rest. We also associate itwith being stress-free and on holiday.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 大部分的人覺得海浪聲具有撫慰的效果而且有趣的是熟睡的人每分鐘的呼吸次數也大約是12次所以海浪聲會讓我們聯想到休息聯想到放鬆聯想到假日

paragraphs.en: The second way in which soundaffects you is psychological. Music is the most powerful formof sound that we know that affects our emotional state.(Albinoni's Adagio) This is guaranteed to make most of youfeel pretty sad if I leave it on.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 聲音也會對我們的心理產生影響音樂是我們所熟知最能影響人類情緒狀態的聲音形式(Albinoni 慢板)若我再播放下去

paragraphs.en: Music is not the only kind of sound,however, which affects your emotions. Natural sound can do that, too.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 你們一定會變得很憂傷但是音樂並不是唯一可以影響你的情緒的聲音自然界的聲音也有這種效果

paragraphs.en: Birdsong, for example, is a soundwhich most people find reassuring. There's a reason:over hundreds of thousands of years we've learned that when the birdsare singing, things are safe.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 舉例來說，鳥叫聲，大部分的人都覺得具有安慰的效果(鳥鳴聲)這是有原因的，自古以來我們就知道若小鳥在鳴唱，就表示安全

paragraphs.en: It's when they stopyou need to be worried. The third way in whichsound affects you is cognitively.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 若叫聲停止了，你就該當心了聲音影響我們的第三種方式是知覺上的

paragraphs.en: You can't understand two peopletalking at once (Voice-over) or in this case, one person talking twice. You have to choose which meyou're going to listen to.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 若二個人同時講話，你就無法同時瞭解其內容(“若你聽這個聲音”)"你就離題了...”)或是像現在同一個人有二個聲音(“你該聽另一個聲音”)你必須選擇你要聽哪一個聲音

paragraphs.en: We have a very small amount of bandwidthfor processing auditory input, which is why noise like this ... (Office noise) is extremely damaging for productivity.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 人腦處理聲音進入的頻寬很窄所以像這種噪音(辦公室噪音)絕對會破壞生產力

paragraphs.en: If you have to workin an open-plan office like this, your productivity is greatly reduced. And whatever number you're thinking of,it probably isn't as bad as this.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 若你是在沒有隔間的辦公室裡工作你的生產力絕對很低你無法想像生產力會低到什麼程度

paragraphs.en: [Open-plan offices productivity down 66%] You are one-third as productivein open-plan offices as in quiet rooms. I have a tip for you: if you work in spaces like that,carry headphones with you, with a soothing sound like birdsong.
paragraphs.zh-tw: (預告聲)在沒有隔間的辦公室裡工作，生產力只有在安靜環境下的三分之一但有一個小方法可以改善這個問題，若你必須在這種環境裡工作就戴上耳機，播放鳥鳴聲等安慰人心的聲音

paragraphs.en: Put them on, and your productivitygoes back up to triple what it would be. The fourth way in whichsound affects us is behaviorally.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 你的生產力就會立刻提升三倍聲音影響我們的第四種方式是行為上的

paragraphs.en: With all that other stuff going on, it would be amazingif our behavior didn't change. (Techno music) So ask yourself: Is this personever going to drive at a steady 28 miles per hour? I don't think so.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 當你聽到這麼多聲音你的行為一定會改變(車上的電子音樂聲)試著想想看：這個開車的人會不會只用28英哩的時速開車？我覺得不會

paragraphs.en: At the simplest, you moveaway from unpleasant sound and towards pleasant sounds. So if I were to play this ...
paragraphs.zh-tw: 最簡單的是，你會逃離不悅耳的聲音轉而尋找你喜歡的聲音

paragraphs.en: (Jackhammer) for more than a few seconds,you'd feel uncomfortable; for more than a few minutes,you'd be leaving the room in droves. For people who can't get awayfrom noise like that, it's extremely damaging for their health.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 若我播放這個聲音(鑽地機聲音)只要放個幾秒，你就會覺得不舒服若放上個幾分鐘，你就會想要逃離這個地方對那些無法避免這些噪音的人來說這些聲音會嚴重損害他們的健康

paragraphs.en: And that's not the only thingthat bad sound damages. Most retail sound is inappropriateand accidental, even hostile, and it has a dramatic effect on sales.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 這不是噪音唯一會破壞的事情大部分店家播放的音樂都不恰當，有些是隨機播放，有些還會製造敵對氣氛這些都會嚴重影響銷售業績

paragraphs.en: For you retailers, you may wantto look away before I show this slide. [Inappropriate retail soundscapessales down 28%] They're losing up to 30 percentof their business with people leaving shops faster,or just turning around at the door.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 若你們之中有人經營店家，你可能會不喜歡我所要播放的投影片業績下滑了百分之三十只因為客戶很快就離開你的店，或是在門口就轉身走了

paragraphs.en: We've all done it, left the area, because the sound in there is so dreadful. I want to spend just a momenttalking about the model we've developed, which allows us to start at the topand look at the drivers of sound, analyze the soundscape and then predict the four outcomesI just talked about.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們都曾經匆促離開某個地方只因為那裡所播放的音樂太恐怖我想花點時間來談談我們所開發出來的模型，從最上面開始是聲音的來源，接下來分析聲音的主軸再來預測我們剛才談到的四個影響層面

paragraphs.en: Or start at the bottomand say what outcomes we want, and then design a soundscapeto have a desired effect. At last we've gotsome science we can apply.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 或是從下面開始先想我們希望得到什麼效果然後設計出我們想要的聲音這是我們現在所使用的科學方法

paragraphs.en: And we're in the businessof designing soundscapes. Just a word on music.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們所從事的是聲音設計這個行業

paragraphs.en: Music is the most powerful sound there is,often inappropriately deployed. It's powerful for two reasons: you recognize it fast,and you associate it very powerfully.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 再來談談音樂，音樂是最有影響力的聲音但也最常被誤用音樂的影響力可從二方面觀察到，你可以很快就認出某些音樂

paragraphs.en: I'll give you two examples. (First chord of "A Hard Day's Night") Most of you recognize that immediately.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 也可以做出很多聯想讓我給你們二個範例(披頭四"A Hard Day's Night"第一個和弦)大部分的人都可以立刻認出這個音樂

paragraphs.en: The younger, maybe not. (First notes of "Jaws" theme) Most of you associate that with something! Now, those are one-secondsamples of music.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 年輕人可能就沒有那麼熟(電影大白鯊主題曲的前二個音)你們應該會聯想到什麼吧！這二個就是我要舉的例子

paragraphs.en: Music is very powerful, and unfortunately, it's veneeringcommercial spaces, often inappropriately. I hope that's going to changeover the next few years.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 音樂具有很強的影響力但現在卻被許多商場錯誤使用我希望在未來幾年內這種情形能有所改變

paragraphs.en: Let me talk about brands for a moment,since some of you run brands. Every brand is out theremaking sound right now.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 接下來談談品牌因為你們之中有些人經營某些品牌

paragraphs.en: There are eight expressions of a brandin sound; they're all important. And every brand needs to haveguidelines at the center.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 現在每個品牌都有自己的聲音品牌的聲音有八種表情每一種都很重要，每一個品牌都應該瞭解如何使用這些聲音

paragraphs.en: I'm glad to saythat is starting to happen now. (Intel ad jingle) You all recognize that one.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 我很高興現在已有品牌開始這樣做了(Intel廣告聲)

paragraphs.en: (Nokia ringtone) This is the most-played tunein the world today -- 1.8 billion times a day,that tune is played. And it cost Nokia absolutely nothing.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 大家都認得出這個聲音(Nokia鈴聲)這是現在世界上最常被播放的聲音每天會播放18億次而Nokia不必付出任何成本

paragraphs.en: I'll leave you with four golden rules,for those of you who run businesses, for commercial sound. First, make it congruent, pointing in the same directionas your visual communication.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 我先告訴你們四個黃金原則這對企業經營者選擇聲音很重要首先，聲音選擇要有一致性要和視覺廣告傳達出相同訊息

paragraphs.en: That increases impactby over 1,100 percent. If your sound is pointingthe opposite direction, incongruent, you reduce impact by 86 percent.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 這樣會提升廣告力度達百分之一千一百若你選擇了相反的聲音，和視覺廣告不一致

paragraphs.en: That's an order of magnitude, up or down. This is important.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 你的廣告力度會降低百分之八十六這關乎廣告的強度，看你是要強或弱這很重要

paragraphs.en: Secondly, make it appropriateto the situation. Thirdly, make it valuable.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 第二，要適合情境

paragraphs.en: Give people something with the sound,don't just bombard them with stuff. Finally, test and test it again.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 第三，要讓聲音產生價值，讓人們可以從這個聲音得到一些東西而不是只提供贈品而已最後，要不斷地測試

paragraphs.en: Sound is complex; there are manycountervailing influences. It can be a bit like a bowl of spaghetti: sometimes you just have to eat itand see what happens.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 聲音是很複雜的，聲音所產生的效果有些還會互相衝突就像面對一碗義大利麵你得先吃了才知道

paragraphs.en: So I hope this talk has raised soundin your consciousness. If you're listening consciously, you can take controlof the sound around you.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 我希望我的演說能讓你們瞭解聲音的影響力若你仔細聽你就可以控制周遭的聲音

paragraphs.en: It's good for your healthand for your productivity. If we all do that, we move to a state that I like to think will besound living in the world.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 對你的健康有幫助，也能提升你的生產力如果我們大家都這麼做這個世界的聲音就會活化起來

paragraphs.en: I'll leave you with more birdsong.(Birds chirping) I recommend at least five minutesa day, but there's no maximum dose. Thank you for lending me your ears today.
paragraphs.zh-tw: 我再播放一些鳥鳴叫聲(鳥鳴聲)我建議你們一天至少聽個五分鐘，至於上限，沒有限制謝謝你們

title: Julian Treasure The 4 Ways Sound Affects Us
